answers.answer: Hello,Cold sensation of the head can be caused by several things, including environmental factors, neurological disease, diabetes, alcohol-related neuropathy, hypothermia, stroke, multiple sclerosis and underactive thyroid.If it is due to environmental factors,then wearing protective clothing like caps,mufflers etc can help.Otherwise,you need to get the other possibilities ruled out by extensive investigations. I sincerely advise you to consult a physician and discuss these possibilities with him.This symptom may only be annoying but can be due to some serious cause like impending stroke also.So clinical examination id definitely required.I hope that helps. Please do keep me posted on how you are doing or if you have any additional queries. Kind regards.

question: Why is my head so cold! The cold sensation begins at the crown of my head and works it's way outward. My scalp is also somewhat tender. I generally experience this sensation when the temperature is 70 degrees or below.  Could this be related to a sinus infection?  I live in a Southern state where 45 is the winter low.
title: Body temperature: an uncommonly cold head
